dialogue_turns.text: Alibaba shares plunged almost seven and a half percent in Hong Kong after that antitrust probe was announced.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba plunged almost 8% in Hong Kong in the immediate aftermath of the announcement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the State Administration for Market Regulation is looking into that "er xuan yi" practice—forcing merchants to sell exclusively on one platform.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the State Administration for Market Regulation is looking into that er xuan yi practice-forcing merchants to sell exclusively on one platform.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The State Administration for Market Regulation said Thursday in a brief post on its website that its investigating Alibabas alleged practice of er xuan yi, which means forcing merchants to sell exclusively on one website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it's not just Alibaba—this seems part of a broader crackdown on tech giants, especially those tied to Jack Ma.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it's not just Alibaba-this seems part of a broader crackdown on tech giants, especially those tied to Jack Ma.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The investigation comes amid heightened scrutiny of businesses co-founded by Chinas one-time richest man Jack Ma.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Last month, regulators proposed new rules to rein in the market influence of his companies, like preventing exclusive contracts or predatory pricing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Last month, regulators proposed new rules to rein in the market influence of his companies, like preventing exclusive contracts or predatory pricing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, Chinas policymakers released a set of draft rules that would give regulators wide-ranging power to rein in the market influence of Mas e-commerce titan. Their intention is to prevent Chinas dominant tech companies from forcing merchants to agree to exclusive contracts or selling their products below cost.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's hitting Ant Group too, right? Their huge IPO got scrapped in November.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's hitting Ant Group too, right? Their huge I P O got scrapped in November.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companys $35 billion initial public offering, which would have been the worlds largest, was scuttled in early November amid sudden changes in the regulatory environment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, a thirty-five billion dollar offering, just… gone. And now financial regulators are summoning them for another meeting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, a thirty-five billion dollar offering, just... gone. And now financial regulators are summoning them for another meeting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companys $35 billion initial public offering, which would have been the worlds largest, was scuttled in early November amid sudden changes in the regulatory environment. Officials from the countrys four top financial regulators that included the countrys central bank, the Peoples Bank of China, and the China Securities Regulatory Commission, said they would soon summon the company to another meeting, according to a report by the official Xinhua News Agency that was published on the same day of the anti-trust probe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So it's like a one-two punch—antitrust for Alibaba and heightened scrutiny for Ant's financial compliance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's like a one-two punch-antitrust for Alibaba and heightened scrutiny for Ant's financial compliance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and both companies say they're cooperating, but investors are clearly spooked.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and both companies say they're cooperating, but investors are clearly spooked.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An Alibaba spokesperson said the company will actively cooperate with the regulators and business operations remain normal. Ant said it will seriously study and strictly comply with all regulatory requirements and commit full efforts to fulfill all related work via its official account on Chinese instant messaging service WeChat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, when you're talking about the world's richest people getting even richer in 2020—almost two trillion dollars richer—it makes sense regulators are stepping in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, when you're talking about the world's richest people getting even richer in twenty twenty-almost two trillion dollars richer-it makes sense regulators are stepping in.

dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's about balancing growth with fairness, preventing monopolistic behavior.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's about balancing growth with fairness, preventing monopolistic behavior.

dialogue_turns.text: And Ant says they'll strictly comply via their WeChat account, but the uncertainty's still there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Ant says they'll strictly comply via their WeChat account, but the uncertainty's still there.

artist_script:
Back in 2020, Alibaba shares plunged almost seven and a half percent in Hong Kong after that antitrust probe was announced.
HostB: Yeah, the State Administration for Market Regulation is looking into that "er xuan yi" practice—forcing merchants to sell exclusively on one platform.
HostA: Right, and it’s not just Alibaba—this seems part of a broader crackdown on tech giants, especially those tied to Jack Ma.
HostB: Exactly. Last month, regulators proposed new rules to rein in the market influence of his companies, like preventing exclusive contracts or predatory pricing.
HostA: And it’s hitting Ant Group too, right? Their huge IPO got scrapped in November.
HostB: Uh-huh, a thirty-five billion dollar offering, just… gone. And now financial regulators are summoning them for another meeting.
HostA: So it’s like a one-two punch—antitrust for Alibaba and heightened scrutiny for Ant’s financial compliance.
HostB: Yeah, and both companies say they’re cooperating, but investors are clearly spooked.
HostA: I mean, when you’re talking about the world’s richest people getting even richer in 2020—almost two trillion dollars richer—it makes sense regulators are stepping in.
HostB: For sure. It’s about balancing growth with fairness, preventing monopolistic behavior.
HostA: And Ant says they’ll strictly comply via their WeChat account, but the uncertainty’s still there.
HostB: Definitely. This is gonna have ripple effects across the whole tech sector in China.
